column4: Does anyone know if the latest version of btnx works w/ hardy heron (as far as the MX revolution is concerned)
I have tried btnx with the 'Logitech USB G9 Laser Mouse' and it will not detect all the buttons. Nor those which aren't already detected initially by the xserver.
this is aggravating.  all it recognizes is scroll, left click, and right click.  do you know of any other solutions (besides btnx)?
I feel your pain.  I tried looking around with that project, and it's just a mess.  I've had no problems with any type of support / documentation for my hardware, except this mouse, haha.
with wine?
no, I have a dual boot system
but that still isn't what I want, i want to get this working completely from ubuntu
I agree, and it seems to have worked in the past and the project has slowed or something
there is an unresolved bug report on btnx-config's launchpad here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/btnx-config/+bug/246526
not good :( The strange thing is that i once managed to get 7 buttons working, all except the left/right tilt. Have you tried running xev from console, and test if xserver detects the buttons?
I haven't... do you have a link for that?
I also believe there is an issue with my mouse being a USB device, and running:  cat /proc/bus/input/devices shows that the input and event changes, breaking my xorg.conf configuration
I agree... i think the original problem lies in recognizing the mouse as a USB device
open a console and type: xev
and then?

I also have read about how the evdev driver has issues understanding  /dev/input/by-id/ and by-path/ symlinks, which is bad, since those symlinks are static and what i would need. Still i believe there is more to it then that
if only logitech could provide some software or answers :P
after executing xev, you should see a box where you can click inside, and the console will print info for the button, if it detects it. if not, nothing will ocurr
I'm pretty sure it recognizes everything but the back/foward buttons, thumb dial, and search button :P

check these sites out, they might help you somewhat maybe: http://meandubuntu.wordpress.com/2007/12/23/logitech-laser-g9-and-ubuntu/ and http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=65471  I started around there and followed links, but for me nothing worked :(
I use a G9 but through there you see info about the MX series
thanks for all the help. now it's time for a sandwich, i'm done messing with this
